dublinCore.dc:title: 113 HR 1298 IH: To amend the Export Apple Act to permit the export of apples to Canada in bulk bins without certification by the Department of Agriculture.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Owens (for himself and Mr. Hanna) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Agriculture

form.official-title: To amend the Export Apple Act to permit the export of apples to Canada in bulk bins without certification by the Department of Agriculture.

section.header: Bulk shipments of apples to canada

subsection.header: Bulk shipment of apples to canada
subsection.text: Section 4 of the Export Apple Act (7 U.S.C. 584) is amendedâ€”

paragraph.text: by striking Apples in and inserting (a) Apples in; and
by adding at the end the following new subsection:

subsection.text: Apples may be shipped to Canada in bulk bins without complying with the provisions of this Act.
Section 9 of the Export Apple Act (7 U.S.C. 589) is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

paragraph.text: The term bulk bin means a bin that contains a quantity of apples weighing more than 100 pounds.

subsection.text: Not later than 60 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary of Agriculture shall issue regulations to carry out the amendments made by this section.
